section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: Department (漁護署) means the Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation Department;
major dog disease (嚴重狗隻疾病) means rabies, parvovirus infection, canine distemper, infectious canine hepatitis or leptospirosis;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (Hong Kong) Trustees Incorporated, a corporation of trustees incorporated under the Registered Trustees Incorporation Ordinance (Cap. 306); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Society for Abandoned Animals Limited, a company incorporated under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 32) as in force at the time of the incorporation;

section.def: registered veterinary surgeon (註冊獸醫) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Veterinary Surgeons Registration Ordinance (Cap. 529);

def.name: TNRProgramme
def.leadIn: TNR programme (“捕絕放計劃”) means a trial programme which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: aims at assessing the effectiveness of the trap-neuter-return mechanism in reducing the number of stray dogs within the trial zones; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is implemented by the programme coordinators;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Cheung Chau trial zone, as delineated and edged blue on the map deposited at the Department’s headquarters which was—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: signed by the Director on 14 October 2014; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Tai Tong trial zone, as delineated and edged blue on the map deposited at the Department’s headquarters which was—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: signed by the Director on 14 October 2014; and

section.name: s3
section.heading: Exemption from provisions on abandonment and control of animals

subsection.content: Section 22(1) of the Ordinance does not apply to a keeper of a dog when the dog is released under the TNR programme.
Section 23(1) of the Ordinance does not apply to a dog when the dog is released under the TNR programme.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Release of dogs under TNR programme

subsection.leadIn: For section 3(1) and (2), a dog is released under the TNR programme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is released within a trial zone by a person carrying an identification card issued by a programme coordinator to show that the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is an employee or volunteer of the coordinator; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has completed a training course organized by the coordinator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it bears an identification mark which is affixed by the coordinator on the basis that it—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has been assessed, in terms of health and temperament, as being suitable for release within a trial zone;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has been neutered by a registered veterinary surgeon; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has been vaccinated against each of the major dog diseases.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must cover animal nutrition, animal behaviour, environmental safety and dog catching methods; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be approved by the Director.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an assessment regarding the health of a dog must be carried out by a registered veterinary surgeon; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an assessment regarding the temperament of a dog must be carried out by—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a dog trainer recognized by the programme coordinator.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Exemption from requirement on licensing of dogs

subsection.content: Section 20(1) of the Rabies Regulation (Cap. 421 sub. leg. A) does not apply to a person keeping a dog under the TNR programme.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1), a person is keeping a dog under the TNR programme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person keeps the dog within the premises of a programme coordinator for the purposes of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: assessing its suitability for being released within a trial zone; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if applicable, neutering it and vaccinating it against each of the major dog diseases; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person is issued with an identification card referred to in section 4(1)(a) and keeps the dog—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: after it has been captured within a trial zone, with a view to bringing it to the premises of the programme coordinator for the purposes specified in paragraph (a)(i) and (ii); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: after it has been affixed with an identification mark referred to in section 4(1)(b), with a view to bringing it to, and releasing it within, a trial zone.
